Description: Two fragments of a red sandstone offering-table; Hieroglyphic text on the front, sides and top with an offering formula invoking Hathor on behalf of the Interior Overseer Khenemsu. A secondary inscription on the side of the object names the cup-bearer (wdpw) Ankhrenef born of Ti.
Curator's comments: Cerny's Inscriptions of Sinai II (1955), p.91 no 84, I, pl. XXXII in Part I; Valbelle and Bonnet's Sanctuaire d'Hathor Maitresse de la Turquoise (1996), p. 155 fig 179. They note that this object may have been originally placed in front of the pillar in the Hathor Cave (1996, 85, fig. 104).
Bibliographic references: Gardiner, Cerny & Peet 1955 / The Inscriptions of Sinai (91, pl. 32 (no. 84))
